formatted_address: Tramore Rd, Coolgower, Waterford, X91 NNP0, Ireland
review_text: La Vida Loca is a fantastic spot with a great atmosphere and consistently delicious food. The chimichangas are a real highlight — crispy, full of flavour, and perfectly cooked. Portions are generous, the menu has plenty of choice, and everything is beautifully presented. Friendly, attentive staff make the experience even better. Highly recommended and well worth a return visit.
review_original_text: La Vida Loca is a fantastic spot with a great atmosphere and consistently delicious food. The chimichangas are a real highlight — crispy, full of flavour, and perfectly cooked. Portions are generous, the menu has plenty of choice, and everything is beautifully presented. Friendly, attentive staff make the experience even better. Highly recommended and well worth a return visit.

formatted_address: Tramore Rd, Coolgower, Waterford, X91 NNP0, Ireland
review_text: Absolutely amazing ! Need to be a permanent feature here in Waterford. Mouth watering food, attentive staff and the tastiest range of flavours you could get a mile around. I think of the food i got here often…!

review_text: Horrible. We couldn’t even eat it so we left it all behind. Chicken wasn’t near hot enough didn’t want to get sick from it. Everything had zero flavour. We came here since Cassie Stokes did a promo for it and I seriously don’t know why she stood over this place..

formatted_address: 12 John St, Waterford, X91 N729, Ireland
review_text:
Ordered at 9pm last night, at 10pm it was finally on the way. The driver didn't move for about 10 minutes so I sent a message on Uber. He then called me to say he's stuck with two orders. The restaurant was closing and had cleaned up and said they aren't making the orders. Told the driver to mark them as collected. He was then stuck with the orders on his app and couldn't do more orders (driver is top rated). Shameful that the restaurant didn't even call themselves. Not my first incident here over customer service ridiculous carry on. Back to Changaro for the customer service.

Update: As much as I'd hate to drag a family business, the way you treat customers here is disgusting. I posted this a month ago, got a reply fairly quick but can now see they've edited their response one day ago. Horrible to be blaming Uber and the drivers when they're the only ones who made contact, you were probably home and all by then. The food was not late, it was refused to be made. Driver was in an awful panic. Hilarious reading all the reviews, but what's even funnier is the we checked CCTV response.. had an issue like this before, claimed staff aka family "didn't do it" and insisted I was lying about an order being wrong. Told them not to bother checking but they called back to say the camera showed driver taking wrong order which was a lie since rest of order was perfect. (Dietary requirements meant the wrong one couldn't be eaten).
But I think the most APPALLING part is the absolute audacity and rudeness of the owner replies. Might be " in the business years " as they say, but clearly have learnt zero customer service... Won't be wasting more time on this review or this place🤑

formatted_address: 39 O'Connell St, Trinity Without, Waterford, X91 CDC7, Ireland
review_text: Incredible food. Prob the best burrito we've ever had. The veg was so fresh. Packed with flavours. Generous portions. The loaded fries also amazing. Great options for every type of eater (meat, veggie and vegan) Accessible to all and lovely outdoor searing by fairy light. The service was impeccable too, very friendly people! Can't wait to go back. Thank you so much!

formatted_address: 39 O'Connell St, Trinity Without, Waterford, X91 CDC7, Ireland
review_text: We had pork, bean chilli and Chipotle chicken tacos - 6 in all for €20. They tasted fantastic, highly recommended but more of a snack than lunch.small portions but packed with flavour. Then ordered the chicken fries, €7.95, which were also tasty. They have an outside eating area which is ideal. Would recommend but would like bigger tacos!!

review_text: My kids usually don't eat burritos and here they loved every bit and gobbled it whole in no time. My oldest kid said it's the best restaurant he's ever been to 😃 I love the signature burrito it's very filling and has a reasonable price. The only thing is that for 4 burritos and drinks &ice creams we paid over 60€ but at least you pay for a healthy and very filling food better then fast food.

formatted_address: Unit 40A, Ardkeen Shopping Centre, Ardkeen, Waterford, X91 DK0Y, Ireland
review_text: Regular burrito was very small. Wasn't worth the price. It's actually hard to imagine that there's a smaller version given how little the fillings are on the regular. Taste wise it was decent though. Staff were a bit all over the place which you'd expect on opening day. One guy was actually openly telling off another staff member for putting too much filling on another man's burrito and it had to be explained to him that the customer ordered a large not a regular. Wouldn't be too harsh given it's the first day but staff def didn't feel or look like they were comfortable. Black girl on the till was great though. Bubbly personality and pleasant to interact with. Wish them the best goin forward but unless they are a bit more generous with the fillings, it's impossible to justify the price.

formatted_address: 3 Broad St, Tramore West, Tramore, Co. Waterford, X91 FH70, Ireland
review_text:
Had my eye on this place a while but never got a chance to try it,

Til tonight. After a couple quiet pints in the Vic I walked out into an early contender for the coldest night of the year. I looked left and like a moth to a flame I wandered towards the welcoming light of Poquito. The takeaway offerings of Tramore has expanded greatly in recent years but I'd been holding out for a nice mexican place. My favourite cuisine. And my standards are not low.

I walked into a colourful and charming tacoterie, clean and well lit where two friendly staff members welcomed me with a warm greeting and we shared commiserations on the cold outside the door.

I ordered a chilli beef burrito.

At this point I expected it would be good and it only exceeded this expectation. It's the real deal. Flavourful and delicately prepared.

Currently well fed and grateful and will be back soon for more.

formatted_address: 3 Broad St, Tramore West, Tramore, Co. Waterford, X91 FH70, Ireland
review_text:
We happened to be staying close by on a wknd in Mt Congrieve. I had been researching places to eat and this caught my eye.

Mexican is my favourite type of cuisine so I have high expectations.

Fresh, tasty, home made sauces, lots of different options and is everything you'd want from a lovely meal! I'll definitely be back to try more of the menu!

formatted_address: 3 Broad St, Tramore West, Tramore, Co. Waterford, X91 FH70, Ireland
review_text:
The birria broth that comes with the birria tacos is outstanding, even more so when you dump the coriander and onion that comes on the side in to it. The taco’s themselves are delicious, tender beef with a nice, umami flavour.

Very friendly staff. A nice selection of Mexican soft drinks set in a lovely part of the world.

formatted_address: 3 Broad St, Tramore West, Tramore, Co. Waterford, X91 FH70, Ireland
review_text:
We went there to get brunch after training and it really hit the spot. The breakfast burrito is amazing and so satisfying. The regular burrito with pulled pork was also really good. They do not skimp on the portions at all and give you a little hot sauce on the side.

The staff was super friendly and offered us water. Also they are super dog friendly and had treats and a water bowl.

We also bought some of their hot sauces. They have a wide variety of different flavours for not very much money and I highly recommend the taster set as a gift for any hot sauce lover.

Overall 10/10 :))

review_text: Wow! Who would’ve thought that some of the most delicious and authentic Tex mex I’ve had would be in Waterford? The quality of food is incredible in here, even the sour cream has depth of flavour. Affordable too, and the staff are friendly and efficient. I was in and out within 2 minutes. From someone that has eaten authentic in Mexico, this is a must visit while in Waterford.

formatted_address: 21 High St, Waterford, X91 YX39, Ireland
review_text:
My partner and I recently celebrated his birthday at Emiliano's in Waterford, and the entire experience was nothing amazing. From the moment we walked in, the restaurant atmosphere felt warm, vibrant, and genuinely Italian.
Exceptional Service is the Standard
The staff at Emiliano's truly elevated our special evening. They were attentive, incredibly friendly, and went out of their way to ensure our celebration felt personal and memorable. Their service was seamless efficient without ever feeling rushed, making us feel completely looked after from start to finish. Big thanks to the team for making the birthday celebrations so wonderful!
The food was the absolute highlight. Everything tasted incredibly fresh and authentic, showcasing true Italian passion.
For starters, we enjoyed the Bruschetta perfectly toasted bread topped with fresh, vibrant tomatoes, mozzarella, and aromatic basil, and fresh Burrata on  delicious, soft fried dough, perfectly complemented by worm Mediterranean salad.
For the main courses, we were equally impressed. The spaghetti fruit do mare was outstanding generously loaded with fresh monk fish, prawns, mussels, clams, and calamari in a rich, deeply flavored tomato sauce, pure comfort food executed flawlessly. We also had the rack of lamb which were cooked to perfection, tender, and juicy, served with a gorgeous, dark reduction sauce and perfectly prepared seasonal vegetables.
Emiliano's isn't just a meal; it's an experience. If you are looking for delicious, high quality Italian food paired with warm, genuine, and professional service in Waterford, look no further. Whether it's a casual dinner or a special occasion like a birthday, Emiliano's is the perfect place. We highly recommend it and can't wait to return!

review_text: Authentic Italian restaurant that serves delicious food. Love the decor and the staff is really nice. As a returning customer, I have tried many different dishes and everything was delicious.

formatted_address: 21 High St, Waterford, X91 YX39, Ireland
review_text: We had a great time here! The servers were great and took time to joke with our table. The ambience and setting is great - super cute and well thought out. The food was delicious! Highly recommend
review_original_text: We had a great time here! The servers were great and took time to joke with our table. The ambience and setting is great - super cute and well thought out. The food was delicious! Highly recommend

formatted_address: Adamstown, Kilmeaden, Co. Waterford, X91 H588, Ireland
review_text: Popped into here on 2nd January with family for lunch. Had the southern style chicken burger, which was outstanding. Thick juicy chicken breast with BBQ sauce, cheese, bacon and frizze onions, served with home made chips. Flavour was fantastic and the frizze onions added a nice bit of crunch. Washed down with a perfect pint of Guinness. Service was faultless and staff were friendly, polite and welcoming, will visit again.
review_original_text: Popped into here on 2nd January with family for lunch. Had the southern style chicken burger, which was outstanding. Thick juicy chicken breast with BBQ sauce, cheese, bacon and frizze onions, served with home made chips. Flavour was fantastic and the frizze onions added a nice bit of crunch. Washed down with a perfect pint of Guinness. Service was faultless and staff were friendly, polite and welcoming, will visit again.

formatted_address: Adamstown, Kilmeaden, Co. Waterford, X91 H588, Ireland
review_text:
Sweep Bar Kilmeaden
Located on the N25 in Kilmeaden just outside Waterford City. Plenty of parking is available outside, including designated disabled spaces. , and the entire premises is wheelchair accessible.
A Traditional Irish Pub. It retains its traditional feel with thatched roof and traditional decor.inside without feeling like a theme pub. Very comfortably furnished, and although I have only ever really been here for food and not drinks, I would imagine that it is a comfortable bar for a drink after the food service has finished.
The service here is good. The staff are quick and efficient, in getting you seated, menus handed out, taking orders and bussing tables. The Sweep can get very busy at peak times, a testament to their great food offering.
Good quality ingredients and plentiful, representing good value for money.
There is a great selection of menu items for both breakfast and lunch. Breakfast offers the traditional fry, but also, pancakes,scrambled eggs, ommlettes, scones. Something for everyone (except those that like Granola) Their lunch offering is as varied with the traditional fayre of a roast dinner to steak sandwiches , and seafood options, with daily specials.
The prices here are average, but you do get a good meal for your money, so definitely good value here.

review_text: Wonderful food and service, and just such a cozy place! I had the best monkfish in my life here! Highly recommend.

formatted_address: 1,2,3, The Pavilion, The Prom, Tramore West, Tramore, Co. Waterford, Ireland
review_text:
Well this restaurant is very interesting and wonderful. The atmosphere was relaxing and magical. I am sure it was because of the Christmas decorations, but the restaurant itself is also very pretty.
Unfortunately, at the time, there were many people, so it was hard to move because the place is small.
The food was delicious, but the mulled wine was bad, but I am from a country that makes a lot of wine, and I know wine well. Unfortunately in Ireland is not good with wine. But any way, it was better than I thought it would be.
The staff were very friendly and kind.
+there are toilets

formatted_address: 1,2,3, The Pavilion, The Prom, Tramore West, Tramore, Co. Waterford, Ireland
review_text: Food was absolutely incredible, the Christmas menu is exceptional.. especially the crostini starter. Chicken wings were very nice. The seafood pie, that is now an option on their updated menu, was lovely. Finished off with the winter berry crumble… an overall very enjoyable experience once again. Staff were very attentive as always.

Staff were very attentive as always.

formatted_address: 1,2,3, The Pavilion, The Prom, Tramore West, Tramore, Co. Waterford, Ireland
review_text: It is just on the seaside..with amazing views❤️❤️. It was too crowded that day but still the service was too quick❤️❤️. Loved the food . The pizza was too hot and thin crust was perfect. The beer battered fish was so fresh and tasty. Highly recommend. Value for money.❤️❤️

review_text: The view was spectacular. The surface was a little bit slow but I think that was due to a staffing issue. The drinks were fun and unique, and we went to this place because it was recommended to us. We did not get the pizza and I think that's where we are went wrong.

formatted_address: 1,2,3, The Pavilion, The Prom, Tramore West, Tramore, Co. Waterford, Ireland
review_text: We went for a long drive to try this restaurant. The ambience is really nice as this is near the beach. It's relaxing to eat here. I love how they are presenting their cocktails and plating food. We were able to try their lunch menu. Set menu is available though from 4pm. The food is ok but i am expecting more from the seafood meals. Though overall service and ambience is really great. If we'll go back i'll try other specials.

formatted_address: 36-37 Great George's St, Trinity Without, Waterford, X91 KFV0, Ireland
review_text: This restaurant is excellent! I highly recommend it. The ingredients are always fresh, and the food is full of flavor. It’s conveniently located in town, with a great address. They offer a wide variety of options, the staff is friendly, and the place itself is charming, spread over two floors. It’s a fusion of Thai cuisine with an Indian twist. To top it off, they offer a lunch menu for just €8.99 — great value for money. No complaints at all!

formatted_address: 36-37 Great George's St, Trinity Without, Waterford, X91 KFV0, Ireland
review_text: I had a DELICIOUS dinner. I ordered off the Vegan Menu, and choose the Vegan Korma. It’s one of their specialties, and it was VERY special. Possibly the best curry dish I have ever had. I also ordered the vegetable spring rolls and they were fresh and yummy. I dined in and had great service!! I am so happy to find Bell Pepper. I 100% recommend!!

formatted_address: 36-37 Great George's St, Trinity Without, Waterford, X91 KFV0, Ireland
review_text:
My wife and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary in Waterford and on a whim went into Bell Pepper as we never eat this type of food. The setting was very modern clean and tidy with a really nice atmosphere.
There was a great selection on the menu and our starters and main course came very efficiently and were really delicious. Our waiter Shalu was very nice and friendly and gave us great service and attention. To get such a great meal for two including wine and beer for under €50 was an added bonus.
Definitely would strongly recommend and will definitely go back if I’m ever in Waterford again.

formatted_address: 20 Michael St, Waterford, X91 D99C, Ireland
review_text: Absolutely loved this Vietnamese restaurant! The pho soup, bao buns, and dumplings were all incredibly tasty — full of flavor and beautifully cooked. The staff were super friendly and welcoming, making the whole experience even better. Prices are very reasonable for the quality you get. Highly recommend this place if you’re looking for delicious Vietnamese food and great service!

review_text: I try bun cha and bao cha. It's so good that I forget to take picture. It's very healthy with a lot of veggie. Their BBQ is good with a sweet taste. Totally recommend to anyone wants to try new food

formatted_address: 20 Michael St, Waterford, X91 D99C, Ireland
review_text: I loved their phở! I’ve been searching for good Vietnamese spots, and I think I finally found one today. I’ve never been to Vietnam, so I can’t compare it to the real thing, but the broth here was delicious—I finished every drop. Highly recommended if you’re visiting Waterford town.

formatted_address: 20 Michael St, Waterford, X91 D99C, Ireland
review_text: Bun Cha Journey is a fantastic spot for authentic Vietnamese food. The bun cha is rich, smoky, and perfectly balanced with fresh herbs and light, flavourful dipping sauce. Portions are generous, ingredients taste fresh, and the presentation is spot on. Friendly service and a relaxed atmosphere make it an easy place to return to. Highly recommended for anyone craving real Vietnamese flavours.

Highly recommended for anyone craving real Vietnamese flavours.

formatted_address: 20 Michael St, Waterford, X91 D99C, Ireland
review_text:
Really cool interior, super vietnam 🇻🇳 themed.

The Bún Chả portion was huge, I’ve been to Vietnam before but you’d never get a portion this big haha I guess the portions have been adjusted for the Irish appetite. It was really delicious nonetheless, very authentic and fresh.

I also got the vietnamese coffee and it was super yummy. I’d definitely recommend coming here especially if you’re just back from a holiday in VN like me and craving some vietnamese food again!

formatted_address: Sleveen, Kill, Co. Waterford, X42 CH66, Ireland
review_text: I am so drunk right now and was in desperate need of carbs and meat. I have never eaten anything quite so beautiful as this. The food coma will be the stuff of legend. Meat feast pizza and a chicken burger will be a must have every time I down my third fireball.
review_original_text: I am so drunk right now and was in desperate need of carbs and meat. I have never eaten anything quite so beautiful as this. The food coma will be the stuff of legend. Meat feast pizza and a chicken burger will be a must have every time I down my third fireball.

formatted_address: Sleveen, Kill, Co. Waterford, X42 CH66, Ireland
review_text: Heard rave reviews about this chipper so I’m hoping we just got them on an off day! Chips weren’t great and battered sausage was dark meat with thick chewy batter. My parents got the fish and it looked good, nice large piece hopefully they used a different type of batter otherwise it would be chewy too. The fish is the only reason for 3 stars otherwise based on the chips and batteries sausage it would be a 1 star unfortunately. Again I have heard really good things so still give them a try and see for yourself. Staff were very pleasant and friendly!
